abstract: A bankruptcy law professor writes that by not honoring contracts that pay for some former officers’ legal fees, the Lehman Brothers estate could actual harm creditors.
snippet: A bankruptcy law professor writes that by not honoring contracts that pay for some former officers’ legal fees, the Lehman Brothers estate could actual harm creditors.
lead_paragraph: On the Opinionator blog of The New York Times, William D. Cohan writes that he finds it distasteful that former Lehman Brothers executives are asking to have some of their legal fees paid for by the fallen bank’s estate.

headline.main: A Different Take on Lehman’s Executive Fees
